intro: Tafalla bonplandiana, commonly known as the Bonplandian tafalla, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences and heart-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
